010package imagingbook.common.util;
011
012import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
013import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
014import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
015import java.lang.annotation.Target;
016import java.lang.reflect.Field;
017import java.util.EnumMap;
018import java.util.LinkedList;
019import java.util.List;
020
021import imagingbook.common.corners.subpixel.SubpixelMaxInterpolator;
022import imagingbook.common.util.Enums.Description;
023
024/**
025 * This class defines static methods for handling enum types.
026 * @author WB
027 *
028 */
029@SuppressWarnings("unused")
030public abstract class Enums {
031
032        /**
033         * This static method returns an array of all constant names (strings) 
034         * for a given enumeration class. 
035         * Names are arranged in the same order as the enum constant definitions.
036         * Assume the enum definition: 
037         * <pre>enum MyEnum {A, B, C};</pre>
038         * Usage: 
039         * <pre>String[] names = getEnumNames(MyEnum.class);</pre>
040         * This returns the array 
041         * <pre>{"A", "B", "C"}</pre>
042         * 
043         * @param <E> the generic enum type
044         * @param enumclass enumeration class
045         * @return array (possibly empty) of names defined for the specified enumeration class
046         */
047        public static <E extends Enum<E>> String[] getEnumNames(Class<E> enumclass) {
048                E[] eConstants = enumclass.getEnumConstants();
049                String[] eNames = new String[eConstants.length];
050                for (int i = 0; i < eConstants.length; i++) {
051                        eNames[i] = eConstants[i].name();
052                }
053                return eNames;
054        }
055        
056//      public static String[] getEnumNames(Class<? extends Enum<?>> enumclass) {
057//              Enum<?>[] eConstants = enumclass.getEnumConstants();
058//              String[] eNames = new String[eConstants.length];
059//              for (int i = 0; i < eConstants.length; i++) {
060//                      eNames[i] = eConstants[i].name();
061//              }
062//              return eNames;
063//      }
064        
065        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
066        
067        /**
068         * Field annotation with a (required) string parameter to supply a descriptive
069         * text to the associated enum constant. Example:
070         * 
071         * <pre>
072         * public enum EnumWithAnnotationsExample {
073         *      &#64;Description("Abra Kadabra") A, 
074         *      &#64;Description("Bubba Can Walk") B, 
075         *      C;
076         * }
077         * </pre>
078         */
079        @Target({ElementType.FIELD})
080        @Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
081        public @interface Description {
082                public String value(); // no default, value must be supplied!
083        }
084        
085        /**
086         * This static method returns an array of all description strings 
087         * attached as {@link Description} annotations to enum-constants
088         * in the given enumeration class.
089         * For non-annotated constants the constants name is used as a substitute.
090         * Descriptions are arranged in the same order as the enum constant definitions.
091         * Usage example:
092         * <pre>
093         * public enum EnumWithAnnotations {
094         *      {@literal @}Description("Abra Kadabra") A, 
095         *      {@literal @}Description("Bubba Can Walk") B,
096         *      C;
097         * }</pre>
098         * This returns the array 
099         * <pre>{"Abra Kadabra", "Bubba Can Walk", "C"}</pre>
100         * 
101         * @param enumClass the enumeration class
102         * @return array (possibly empty) of descriptions defined for the specified enumeration class
103         */
104        public static String[] getEnumDescriptions(Class<? extends Enum<?>> enumClass) {
105                Field[] declaredFields = enumClass.getDeclaredFields();
106                List<String> descList = new LinkedList<>();
107                for (Field df : declaredFields) {
108                        if (df.isEnumConstant()) {
109                                Description desc = df.getDeclaredAnnotation(Description.class);
110                                String descString = (desc != null) ? desc.value() : df.getName();
111                                descList.add(descString);
112                        }
113                }
114                return descList.toArray(new String[0]);
115        }
116        
117        /**
118         * Returns an {@link EnumMap} with the enum constants as the keys and the 
119         * associated descriptions (of type {@link String}) as the values.
120         * Descriptions are specified by annotating enum fields (see {@link Description}).
121         * For non-annotated constants the constants name is used as a substitute.
122         * Keys and values are arranged in the same order as the enum constant definitions.
123         * This is experimental code (currently unused).
124         * 
125         * @param <E> the generic enumeration type
126         * @param enumClass the enumeration class
127         * @return a map as described
128         */
129        public static <E extends Enum<E>> EnumMap<E, String> getEnumDescriptionsMap(Class<E> enumClass) {
130                EnumMap<E, String> map = new EnumMap<E, String>(enumClass);
131                Field[] declaredFields = enumClass.getDeclaredFields();
132                for (Field df : declaredFields) {
133                        if (df.isEnumConstant()) {
134                                E enumConst = Enum.valueOf(enumClass, df.getName());
135                                Description desc = df.getDeclaredAnnotation(Description.class);
136                                String descString = (desc != null) ? desc.value() : df.getName();
137                                map.put(enumConst, descString);
138                        }
139                }
140                return map;
141        }
142
143        
144        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
145        
146//      public static void main(String[] args) {
147//              Class<? extends Enum<?>> enumClass;
148//              
149//              enumClass = SubpixelMaxInterpolator.Method.class;
150//              System.out.println("*** enumClass = " + enumClass.getSimpleName());
151//              for (String d : Enums.getEnumNames(enumClass)) {
152//                      System.out.println(d);
153//              }
154//              for (String d : Enums.getEnumDescriptions(enumClass)) {
155//                      System.out.println(d);
156//              }
157//              
158//              enumClass = EnumWithAnnotationsExample.class;
159//              System.out.println("*** enumClass = " + enumClass.getSimpleName());
160//              for (String d : Enums.getEnumNames(enumClass)) {
161//                      System.out.println(d);
162//              }
163//              for (String d : Enums.getEnumDescriptions(enumClass)) {
164//                      System.out.println(d);
165//              }
166//              
167//              
168//              System.out.println("*** map test:");
169//              EnumMap<? extends Enum<?>, String> map = getEnumDescriptionsMap(EnumWithAnnotations.class);
170//              for (Enum<?> m : map.keySet()) {
171//                      System.out.println(m.name() + " -> " + map.get(m));
172//              }
173//      }
174        
175}
